snippet: The trustees of the Brooklyn Public Library approved a plan that calls for a developer to build a 30-story building that would include housing, retail, a school gym and the Brooklyn Heights branch.
abstract: Brooklyn Public Library's board of trustees unanimously approves recommendation to let city sell land beneath its Brooklyn Heights branch to a developer; requires that developer build library on ground floor and affordable housing units around borough; proceeds from sale would help library reach $300 million it needs for repairs across its 60 branches.
lead_paragraph: The trustees of the Brooklyn Public Library approved a plan that calls for a developer to build a 30-story building that would include housing, retail, a school gym and the Brooklyn Heights branch.

headline.main: Trustees Endorse Plan to Sell Land Beneath Branch of Brooklyn Library
headline.print_headline: Trustees Endorse Plan to Sell Land Beneath Branch of Brooklyn Library
